On Jun 29, 2018, at 2:20 PM, J.R.O wrote:

> So after many conference calls on this matter, it has tumed out to be a rather unique large
> breach. It appears Shift4 has not been breached; however, bad actors have gained access to
> older tokens, re-submitted information to the Shift4 system for re-tokenization, received new
> token values and then were able to make purchases.
>
> Secret Service Cyber Fraud Task Force has been engaged. They will be working with our
> compliance department in conjunction with legal to get a handle on the overall exposure. My
> understanding from the call is that there are approximately 700,000 tokens compromised and
> that is across the entire base of tokens. I did confirm that these token were all generated prior to
> May of 2017 back 1 O years.
>
> Legal in conjunction with outside counsel indicates that we may be looking at a large security
> issue. Right now, on the surface it appears as 4 to $500, 000 in potential exposure has happened
